entries: The Guild Wars franchise is the flagship franchise of the Washington state based development studio ArenaNet.
The fifth entry into it's now 20 year old story is Guild Wars 2.
This book aims to capture the story and the feelings of this beloved game, and bring them to the gaming table with the help of the Dungeons & Dragons 5 edition rule set.
All credit goes to the amazing people at ArenaNet and NCSoft, who have given us players such magical adventures.

classFeature.name: Subclass Choice
entries: You gain a subclass of your choice. Your choice grants you features at levels 1, 3, 5, 10, 15, and 20.
Intelligence is your ability score for your Elementalist features.

classFeature.name: Effervescent Shoals
entries: Channeling the Element of Water to heal and mend your learned some new skills. To start, you learn one {@variantrule Healing Skill|GW2|Healing Skill} of your choice, for which you qualify, from the {@table Elementalist Healing Skills|GW2} table. The number of {@variantrule Healing Skill|GW2|Healing Skills} you know increases as you gain Elementalist levels, as shown in the Healing Skills Known column of the Elementalist Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional {@variantrule Healing Skill|GW2|Healing Skills}, for which you qualify, from the {@table Elementalist Healing Skills|GW2} table until the number of {@variantrule Healing Skill|GW2|Healing Skill} on your list matches the number on the table.

You can only prepare and use one {@variantrule Healing Skill|GW2|Healing Skill} at a time, choosing from your learned {@variantrule Healing Skill|GW2|Healing Skills}. You can change which healing skill you have prepared during a {@variantrule short rest|XPHB|short} or {@variantrule long rest|XPHB}.

Healing others requires innate energy. You have a pool of healing power that replenishes when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. The pool has a number of healing points equal to 15 times your Elementalist level. Once per {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you can choose to regain healing points equal to 5 times your Elementalist level.

When you use a {@variantrule Skill|GW2} that restores hit points, you must expend healing points from your pool equal to the amount of hit points restored. If you don't have enough healing points in your pool to cover the total hit points restored, you can only restore a number of hit points equal to the remaining healing points in your pool, while the rest is instead applied as {@variantrule Barrier|GW2}, and your pool is reduced to 0.
If you do not want to use your healing pool, or cannot, you can choose to apply the healing effect as {@variantrule Barrier|GW2} instead of restoring hit points.

classFeature.name: Elemental Channeling
entries: You learned to channel your Elemental magic through specific weapons, unleashing their potential. Depending on the weapon you wield, your Elementalist level, if you have proficiency with that weapon, in which hand you wield it, which attunement your are in, and if qualify for it, you gain access to different {@variantrule weapon skill|GW2|weapon skills} as shown in the {@table Elementalist Weapon Skills: Fire Attunement|GW2}, {@table Elementalist Weapon Skills: Water Attunement|GW2}, {@table Elementalist Weapon Skills: Air Attunement|GW2}, and {@table Elementalist Weapon Skills: Earth Attunement|GW2} tables.

Whenever you attack with one of the weapons as part of a {@variantrule weapon skill|GW2}, you can use your Intelligence modifier for the attack and damage rolls instead of using Strength or Dexterity. If a {@variantrule weapon skill|GW2} requires a saving throw, the DC equals to 8 plus your Intelligence modifier and proficiency bonus plus any attack bonuses the weapon has.

Using the {@variantrule skill|GW2|skills} ascociated with your weapon requires great focus, you can only gain access to the {@variantrule skill|GW2|skills} for one weapon at a time. You can change which weapon you are channeling during a {@variantrule short rest|XPHB|short} or {@variantrule long rest|XPHB}.
When you reach certain levels in this class, you can channel additional weapons. At level 7 you can channel a second weapon, if that weapon is wielded in your off hand.

classFeature.name: Primordial Influence
entries: You have learned to exert finer control over the Elements. Your learn the {@spell Elementalism|XPHB} cantrip, Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

Furthermore, your connection to the Primordial Forces is increased. You learn {@language Primordial|XPHB} and when you take the {@action Influence|XPHB} action, when trying to influence an Elemental, you can add your Intelligence modifier to the roll. Additionally, when taking the {@action Study|XPHB} action to learn about Elementals, you can add your Intelligence modifier to the roll.
Additionally, the elements have started to resonate with you. Depending on your current attunement, you gain a different benefit:
- {@b Fire Attunement.} You gain {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet.
- {@b Water Attunement.} You can breathe underwater and gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

- {@b Air Attunement.} You learn the {@spell Jump|XPHB} and {@spell Feather Fall|XPHB} spells, Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for them. You can cast them without expending a spell slot a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

- {@b Earth Attunement.} As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you gain {@sense Tremorsense|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet for 10 minutes. You can use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Elemental Prowess
entries: Your Elementalisting prowess has granted you access to {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits} that enhance your abilities. To start, you gain access to the Specialization of your subclass and learn its Minor Adept {@variantrule traits|GW2|trait}.

The number of {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits} you know increases as you gain Elementalist levels, as shown in the Traits column of the Elementalist Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits} from the {@table Elementalist Traits|GW2} table until the number of {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits} on your list matches the number on the table. You can only learn {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits} from the Specializations you have access to and must follow the prerequisites for each {@variantrule traits|GW2|trait}.

Each Major {@variantrule traits|GW2|trait} has three options to choose from. When you learn a Major {@variantrule traits|GW2|trait}, you learn all three options, but you can only prepare one option at a time. You can change which option you have prepared during a {@variantrule short rest|XPHB|short} or {@variantrule long rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Specialization
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Elementalist subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Elementalist levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Anchor Energy
entries: Your Elementalisting prowess has led to you inventing new ways to succeed. To start, you learn five {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills} of your choice, for which you qualify, from the {@table Elementalist Utility Skills|GW2} table. The number of {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills} you know increases as you gain Elementalist levels, as shown in the Utility Skills Known column of the Elementalist Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills}, for which you qualify, from the {@table Elementalist Utility Skills|GW2} until the number of {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills} on your list matches the number on the table.

You can only prepare and use one {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skill} at a time. You can change which {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skill} you have prepared during a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Elementalist subclass.

classFeature.name: Elemental Expertise
entries: Your expertise in Elementalisting has granted you access to a second Specialization. Choose a Specialization of your choice for which you qualify from the {@table Elementalist Traits|GW2} table. When learning new {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits}, you can choose {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits} from either of your Specializations.

classFeature.name: Primordial Mastery
entries: You can now influence the Elements in more profound ways. You learn the {@spell Fire Dance|BookofEbonTides}, {@spell Control Water|XPHB}, {@spell Control Winds|XGE} and {@spell Stone Shape|XPHB} spells, Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells. You can cast them only while attuned to their respective Element. You can cast each of these spells once without expending a spell slot, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a {@variantrule long rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Elementalist levels 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Channeled Energy
entries: Your extensive training has made you exceptionally prepared for any situation. You can now prepare and use two {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills} at a time.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Elementalist subclass.

classFeature.name: Rapid Channeling
entries: You have learned to channel your Elementalisting prowess through more weapons. You can designate a second set of weapons you can enhance, the second set either consists of one weapon wielded in your main hand and one in your off hand, or one two-handed weapon. Once during your turn, you can swap between them (no {@variantrule action|XPHB} required). Once you swamp weapons, you cannot switch again until recharged ({@chance 55|10+}).

classFeature.name: Energy Apotheosis
entries: You can now prepare and use three {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills} at a time.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Elementalist level 16.

classFeature.name: Elemental Perfection
entries: You perfected your Elementalisting. Choose a Specialization of your choice for which you qualify from the {@table Elementalist Traits|GW2} table, that you do not already have access to. When learning new {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits}, you can choose {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits} from any of your Specializations.

classFeature.name: Primordial Supremacy
entries: Your connection to the Primordial Forces deepens. You can now cast each spell from the Primordial Mastery feature twice without expending a spell slot, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a {@variantrule long rest|XPHB}.
Furthermore, the attunement benefits you gain from the Primordial Influence feature improve:
- {@b Fire Attunement.} Your {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} range increases to 120 feet. Additionally, you gain {@sense Truesight|XPHB} with a range of 30 feet.
- {@b Water Attunement.} You learn the {@spell Water Walk|XPHB} and {@spell Water Breathing|XPHB} spells, Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for them. You can cast them at will.
- {@b Air Attunement.} You gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 60 feet and can hover.
- {@b Earth Attunement.} The range of your {@sense Tremorsense|XPHB} increases to 120 feet. Additionally, you gain a {@variantrule Burrow Speed|XPHB} equal to your walking speed.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Elementalist subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Elemental Cataclysm
entries: You have mastered the use of {@variantrule elite skill|GW2|Elite Skills} that provide powerful effects. To start, you learn one {@variantrule elite skill|GW2|Elite Skill} of your choice, for which you qualify, from the {@table Elementalist Elite Skills|GW2} table. The number of {@variantrule elite skill|GW2|Elite Skills} you know increases as you gain Elementalist levels, as shown in the Elite Skills Known column of the Elementalist Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional {@variantrule Elite Skill|GW2|Elite Skills}, for which you qualify, from the Elementalist {@table Elementalist Elite Skills|GW2} table until the number of {@variantrule Elite Skill|GW2|Elite Skills} on your list matches the number on the table.
You can only prepare and use one {@variantrule Elite Skill|GW2|Elite Skill} at a time. You can change which {@variantrule Elite Skill|GW2|Elite Skill} you have prepared during a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Primordial Ascension
entries: You have ascended to a new height of Elemental mastery. You can cast the spells from the Primordial Mastery feature at will, without expending a spell slot.
Additionally, the non-improved attunement benefits you gain from the Primordial Influence feature are now always active.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@filter Epic Boon feat|feats|category=EB} or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Elementalist subclass.

classFeature.name: Subclass Choice
entries: You gain a subclass of your choice. Your choice grants you features at levels 1, 3, 5, 10, 15, and 20.
Intelligence is your ability score for your Engineer features.

classFeature.name: Restorative Ingenuity
entries: You have learned unique ways to heal wounds and mend injuries. To start, you learn one {@variantrule Healing Skill|GW2|Healing Skill} of your choice, for which you qualify, from the {@table Engineer Healing Skills|GW2} table. The number of {@variantrule Healing Skill|GW2|Healing Skills} you know increases as you gain Engineer levels, as shown in the Healing Skills Known column of the Engineer Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional {@variantrule Healing Skill|GW2|Healing Skills}, for which you qualify, from the {@table Engineer Healing Skills|GW2} table until the number of {@variantrule Healing Skill|GW2|Healing Skill} on your list matches the number on the table.

You can only prepare and use one {@variantrule Healing Skill|GW2|Healing Skill} at a time, choosing from your learned {@variantrule Healing Skill|GW2|Healing Skills}. You can change which healing skill you have prepared during a {@variantrule short rest|XPHB|short} or {@variantrule long rest|XPHB}.

Healing others requires innate energy. You have a pool of healing power that replenishes when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. The pool has a number of healing points equal to 15 times your Engineer level. Once per {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you can choose to regain healing points equal to 5 times your Engineer level.

When you use a {@variantrule Skill|GW2} that restores hit points, you must expend healing points from your pool equal to the amount of hit points restored. If you don't have enough healing points in your pool to cover the total hit points restored, you can only restore a number of hit points equal to the remaining healing points in your pool, while the rest is instead applied as {@variantrule Barrier|GW2}, and your pool is reduced to 0.
If you do not want to use your healing pool, or cannot, you can choose to apply the healing effect as {@variantrule Barrier|GW2} instead of restoring hit points.

classFeature.name: Mechanized Mayhem
entries: Your Engineer training has given you access to unique ways to enhance your weapons. Depending on the weapon you wield, your Engineer level, if you have proficiency with that weapon, in which hand you wield it, and if qualify for it, you gain access to different {@variantrule weapon skill|GW2|weapon skills} as shown in the {@table Engineer Weapon Skills|GW2} table.

Whenever you attack with one of the weapons as part of a {@variantrule weapon skill|GW2}, you can use your Intelligence modifier for the attack and damage rolls instead of using Strength or Dexterity. If a {@variantrule weapon skill|GW2} requires a saving throw, the DC equals to 8 plus your Intelligence modifier and proficiency bonus plus any attack bonuses the weapon has.

Using the {@variantrule skill|GW2|skills} ascociated with your weapon requires great focus, you can only gain access to the {@variantrule skill|GW2|skills} for one weapon at a time. You can change which weapon you are using during a {@variantrule short rest|XPHB|short} or {@variantrule long rest|XPHB}.
When you reach certain levels in this class, you can enhance additional weapons. At level 7 you can enhance a second weapon, if that weapon is wielded in your off hand.

classFeature.name: Omni-Tool
entries: You have a versatile Omni-Tool that can adapt to a variety of situations. This tool takes the form of a wrench, screwdriver, or other basic tool. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can touch the tool and transform it into one of the following: {@item Carpenter's Tools|XPHB}, {@item Jeweler's Tools|XPHB}, {@item Mason's Tools|XPHB}, {@item Smith's Tools|XPHB}, {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}, {@item Tinker's Tools|XPHB} or {@item Woodcarver's Tools|XPHB}. Whatever form the tool takes, you have proficiency with it when you use it.
You can only have one Omni-Tool at a time. If you try to create a new one while you still have your current one, the current one is destroyed.
If you loose or destroy your Omni-Tool, you can create a new one during a {@variantrule long rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Engineering Prowess
entries: Your Engineering prowess has granted you access to {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits} that enhance your abilities. To start, you gain access to the Specialization of your subclass and learn its Minor Adept {@variantrule traits|GW2|trait}.

The number of {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits} you know increases as you gain Engineer levels, as shown in the Traits column of the Engineer Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits} from the {@table Engineer Traits|GW2} table until the number of {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits} on your list matches the number on the table. You can only learn {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits} from the Specializations you have access to and must follow the prerequisites for each {@variantrule traits|GW2|trait}.

Each Major {@variantrule traits|GW2|trait} has three options to choose from. When you learn a Major {@variantrule traits|GW2|trait}, you learn all three options, but you can only prepare one option at a time. You can change which option you have prepared during a {@variantrule short rest|XPHB|short} or {@variantrule long rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Specialization
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Engineer subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Engineer levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: A Skill for every Job
entries: Your engineering prowess has led to you inventing new ways to succeed. To start, you learn five {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills} of your choice, for which you qualify, from the {@table Engineer Utility Skills|GW2} table. The number of {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills} you know increases as you gain Engineer levels, as shown in the Utility Skills Known column of the Engineer Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills}, for which you qualify, from the {@table Engineer Utility Skills|GW2} until the number of {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills} on your list matches the number on the table.

You can only prepare and use one {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skill} at a time. You can change which {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skill} you have prepared during a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Engineer subclass.

classFeature.name: Engineering Expertise
entries: Your expertise in engineering has granted you access to a second Specialization. Choose a Specialization of your choice for which you qualify from the {@table Engineer Traits|GW2} table. When learning new {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits}, you can choose {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits} from either of your Specializations.

classFeature.name: Quick-Fix Omni-Tool
entries: Your Omni-Tool has been modified for rapid repairs. While holding your Omni-Tool, you can use your {@variantrule bonus action|XPHB} to cast the {@spell Mending|XPHB} spell.
Additionally, while using your Omni-Tool to craft an item using the crafting rules in the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|XDMG}, the amount of time required to craft it is halved.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Engineer levels 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Always Prepared
entries: Your extensive training has made you exceptionally prepared for any situation. You can now prepare and use two {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills} at a time.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Engineer subclass.

classFeature.name: Mechanized Multiplicity
entries: You have learned to channel your engineering prowess through more weapons. You can designate a second set of weapons you can enhance, the second set either consists of one weapon wielded in your main hand and one in your off hand, or one two-handed weapon. Once during your turn, you can swap between them (no {@variantrule action|XPHB} required). Once you swamp weapons, you cannot switch again until recharged ({@chance 55|10+}).

classFeature.name: Eternally Prepared
entries: You can now prepare and use three {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills} at a time.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Engineer level 16.

classFeature.name: Engineering Perfection
entries: You perfected your engineering. Choose a Specialization of your choice for which you qualify from the {@table Engineer Traits|GW2} table, that you do not already have access to. When learning new {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits}, you can choose {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits} from any of your Specializations.

classFeature.name: Omega-Tool
entries: Your Omni-Tool has evolved into an Omega-Tool, capable of transforming into any tool you might need. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can touch the tool and transform it into any set of {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} or {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}. Whatever form the tool takes, you have expertise with it when you use it.

classFeature.name: Advanced Engineering
entries: Your advanced engineering allows you to reshape the world around you. While holding your Omega-Tool, you can use a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to cast the {@spell Fabricate|XPHB} spell.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@filter Epic Boon feat|feats|category=EB} or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature

entries: You gain a subclass of your choice. Your choice grants you features at levels 1, 3, 5, 10, 15, and 20.
Charisma is your ability score for your Thief features.

classFeature.name: Weapons of Thievery
entries: Using weapons in unique ways you have mastered the art of thievery. Depending on the weapon you wield, your Thief level, if you have proficiency with that weapon, in which hand you wield it, which weapon you are wielding in your off hand, and if qualify for it, you gain access to different {@variantrule weapon skill|GW2|weapon skills} as shown in the {@table Thief Weapon Skills|GW2} table.

classFeature.name: Quick Study
entries: You have learned to quickly adapt to new tools and situations. You can use a {@variantrule bonus action|XPHB} to gain proficiency with one {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB}, {@item Musical Instrument|XPHB}, {@item Gaming Set|XPHB}, or {@table Skill List; Skills|XPHB|Skill} for 1 hour. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule long rest|XPHB}.
Additionally, you gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in one of your Skill Proficiencies of your choice.

classFeature.name: Specialized Burglary

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule long rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Study Master
entries: Your Quick Study feature has improved. You now gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} instead of proficiency when you use it. Additionally, you now regain all expended uses of the feature when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
Furthermore, you gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in two of your Skill Proficiencies of your choice.
Lastly, when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can choose to know one Language of your choice until you finish your next {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

Rather than regaining Hit Points, you roll the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} and add the number rolled to the ability check, potentially turning it into a success. If the check still fails, you regain the {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Warrior levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Prepared for Battle
entries: You have many ways to win a fight. To start, you learn five {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills} of your choice, for which you qualify, from the {@table Warrior Utility Skills|GW2} table. The number of {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills} you know increases as you gain Warrior levels, as shown in the Utility Skills Known column of the Warrior Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills}, for which you qualify, from the {@table Warrior Utility Skills|GW2} until the number of {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills} on your list matches the number on the table.

You can only prepare and use one {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skill} at a time. You can change which {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skill} you have prepared during a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Warrior subclass.

classFeature.name: Battle Expertise
entries: Your expertise in battle has granted you access to a second Specialization. Choose a Specialization of your choice for which you qualify from the {@table Warrior Traits|GW2} table. When learning new {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits}, you can choose {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits} from either of your Specializations.

classFeature.name: Battlefield Preparedness
entries: You can quickly analyze the battlefield to gain an advantage. You can spend 1 minute studying an area of up to 100 square feet. After doing so, you and your allies gain advantage on {@variantrule ability checks|XPHB} and {@variantrule saving throws|XPHB} made to avoid environmental hazards in that area. Additionally, you and your allies can ignore difficult terrain in that area. This effect lasts for 1 hour or until you use this feature again.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Warrior levels 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Improved Preparedness
entries: Your extensive training has made you exceptionally prepared for any situation. You can now prepare and use two {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills} at a time.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Warrior subclass.

classFeature.name: God of Weapons
entries: You have learned to use more weapons. You can designate a second set of weapons you can enhance, the second set either consists of one weapon wielded in your main hand and one in your off hand, or one two-handed weapon. Once during your turn, you can swap between them (no {@variantrule action|XPHB} required). Once you swamp weapons, you cannot switch again until recharged ({@chance 55|10+}).

classFeature.name: Always Prepared
entries: You can now prepare and use three {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills} at a time.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Warrior level 16.

classFeature.name: Battle Perfection
entries: You perfected your battle skills. Choose a Specialization of your choice for which you qualify from the {@table Warrior Traits|GW2} table, that you do not already have access to. When learning new {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits}, you can choose {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits} from any of your Specializations.

classFeature.name: Iron Will
entries: Your mind is as strong as your body, pushing you to overcome any challenge. You only need to sleep for 4 hours to gain the benefits of a {@variantrule long rest|XPHB} and only need to rest for 30 minutes to gain the benefits of a {@variantrule short rest|XPHB}. Additionally, you only need half as much food and water as normal.
Furthermore, you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed|XPHB} or {@condition frightened|XPHB}.

Lastly, when you use your Success at any Cost feature, you can choose to roll a d6 instead of a {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}. This use of a d6 does not expend a {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Warrior subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Elite Warrior
entries: You have mastered the use of {@variantrule elite skill|GW2|Elite Skills} that provide powerful effects. To start, you learn one {@variantrule elite skill|GW2|Elite Skill} of your choice, for which you qualify, from the {@table Warrior Elite Skills|GW2} table. The number of {@variantrule elite skill|GW2|Elite Skills} you know increases as you gain Warrior levels, as shown in the Elite Skills Known column of the Warrior Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional {@variantrule Elite Skill|GW2|Elite Skills}, for which you qualify, from the Warrior {@table Warrior Elite Skills|GW2} table until the number of {@variantrule Elite Skill|GW2|Elite Skills} on your list matches the number on the table.
You can only prepare and use one {@variantrule Elite Skill|GW2|Elite Skill} at a time. You can change which {@variantrule Elite Skill|GW2|Elite Skill} you have prepared during a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Victory or Death
entries: You can push yourself to the brink of death and come back stronger. When you fail a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can choose to drop to 1 Hit Point and turn the roll into a 20. You cannot use this feature while {@condition Bloodied|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@filter Epic Boon feat|feats|category=EB} or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Warrior subclass.

entries.name: Elementalist
entries: Elementalists are multifaceted spellcasters who channel elemental forces, making fire, air, earth, and water do their bidding. What they lack in physical toughness, they make up for in versatility and the ability to inflict massive damage.

entries.name: Necromancer
entries: Practitioners of the dark arts, necromancers summon minions, wield the power of ritual, and heal themselves with blood magic. Necromancers feed on life force, which they can leverage offensively or use to delay their own demise.

optionalfeature.name: Darkvision
entries: A life spent in shadow has made you grow accustomed to the gloom. You can see in Dim Light within 60 feet of you as if it were Bright Light, and in Darkness within 60 feet of you as if it were Dim Light. You can't discern color in Darkness, only shades of gray.
{@b Improved Darkvision}. If you take this trait twice, the range of your Darkvision increases to 120 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Asuran Ingenuity
entries: You time with the Asuran Colleges has given you access to their best inventions. You learn the following {@variantrule Skill|GW2|skills} and can prepare them as you gain access to features that allow you to prepare them:
{@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills}: {@optfeature Pain Inverter|GW2}, {@optfeature Radiation Field|GW2}, and {@optfeature Technobabble|GW2}.
{@variantrule Elite Skill|GW2|Elite Skills}: {@optfeature Summon 7-Series Golem|GW2}, {@optfeature Summon D-Series Golem|GW2}, and {@optfeature Summon Power Suit|GW2}.

optionalfeature.name: Pain Inverter
entries: {@b Description:} Apply confusion to nearby foes. You gain resolution.

optionalfeature.name: Radiation Field
entries: {@b Description:} Create a Radiation Field at target location, inflicting poison and weakness on foes.

optionalfeature.name: Summon 7-Series Golem
entries: {@b Description:} Summon a 7-Series attacking golem to fight for you.

optionalfeature.name: Summon D-Series Golem
entries: {@b Description:} Summon a D-Series defensive golem.

optionalfeature.name: Summon Power Suit
entries: {@b Description:} Summon a Power Suit which you or your allies can enter and use to combat foes.

optionalfeature.name: Pain Transference

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Pain Inverter

entries: {@b Description:} Send out a bolt that steals a boon from your foe and gives them one condition from you.

optionalfeature.name: Vent Radiation

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Radiation Field

entries: {@b Description:} Vent radioactive gas to poison nearby foes.

optionalfeature.name: Confusing Speech
entries: {@b Description:} Confuse nearby foes with complex calculations.

optionalfeature.name: Launch Fists
entries: {@b Description:} Launch the fist of the hazmat suit at foe.

optionalfeature.name: Gatling Fists
entries: {@b Description:} Shoot a barrage of missiles at target foe.

optionalfeature.name: Whirling Assault
entries: {@b Description:} Spin the upper portion of the hazmat suit, knocking back foes.

optionalfeature.name: Self-Repair
entries: {@b Description:} Engage the Hazmat suit's self-repair mechanism, healing yourself at a constant rate up to the threshold.

optionalfeature.name: Charr Handiwork
entries: The Legions have tought you well. You learn the following {@variantrule Skill|GW2|skills} and can prepare them as you gain access to features that allow you to prepare them:
{@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills}: {@optfeature Battle Roar|GW2}, {@optfeature Hidden Pistol|GW2}, and {@optfeature Shrapnel Mine|GW2}.
{@variantrule Elite Skill|GW2|Elite Skills}: {@optfeature Artillery Barrage|GW2}, {@optfeature Charrzooka|GW2}, and {@optfeature Warband Support|GW2}.

optionalfeature.name: Battle Roar
entries: {@b Description:} Let out a battle roar, giving might and fury to nearby allies.

optionalfeature.name: Hidden Pistol
entries: {@b Description:} Shoot target foe with a hidden pistol while evading backward.

optionalfeature.name: Shrapnel Mine
entries: {@b Properties:} Explosive, Inflicts Bleeding, Inflicts Cripple
{@b Description:} Throw a shrapnel mine that bleeds and cripples foes.

optionalfeature.name: Artillery Barrage
entries: {@b Description:} Call down an artillery barrage at target location, damaging foes.

optionalfeature.name: Charrzooka
entries: {@b Description:} Pull out a powerful charrzooka that shoots rockets.

optionalfeature.name: Warband Support
entries: {@b Description:} Call in members of your warband to assist you.

optionalfeature.name: Invigorating Roar

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Battle Roar

entries: {@b Properties:} Removes Weakness, Removes Vulnerability, Grants Vigor
{@b Description:} Let out an inspiring roar, removing weakness and vulnerability from allies and granting vigor.

optionalfeature.name: Booby Trap

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Shrapnel Mine

entries: {@b Description:} Place an explosive charge on yourself that is triggered by a melee attack.

optionalfeature.name: Hidden Pistols

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Hidden Pistol

entries: {@b Description:} Draw both hidden pistols and unload a volley of bullets on your foe.

optionalfeature.name: Fire Rocket
entries: {@b Description:} Shoot a rocket at your foe, setting them on fire.

optionalfeature.name: Rocket Spray
entries: {@b Description:} Fire a spray of rockets.

optionalfeature.name: Heat Seeker
entries: {@b Description:} Fire a super-powered heat-seeking rocket.

optionalfeature.name: Rocket Jump
entries: {@b Description:} Blast the ground, damaging and knocking down nearby foes and leaping backward.

optionalfeature.name: Fire Rocket Barrage
entries: {@b Description:} Fire a barrage of rockets at the target location.

optionalfeature.name: Human Conviction
entries: The Legions have tought you well. You learn the following {@variantrule Skill|GW2|skills} and can prepare them as you gain access to features that allow you to prepare them:
{@variantrule Healing Skill|GW2|Healing Skills}: {@optfeature Prayer to Dwayna|GW2}
{@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills}: {@optfeature Prayer to Kormir|GW2} and {@optfeature Prayer to Lyssa|GW2}.
{@variantrule Elite Skill|GW2|Elite Skills}: {@optfeature Avatar of Melandru|GW2}, {@optfeature Hounds of Balthazar|GW2}, and {@optfeature Reaper of Grenth|GW2}.

optionalfeature.name: Prayer to Dwayna
entries: {@b Description:} Beseech Dwayna to restore your health.

optionalfeature.name: Prayer to Kormir
entries: {@b Description:} Beseech Kormir to remove 3 conditions from you.

optionalfeature.name: Prayer to Lyssa
entries: {@b Description:} Pray to Lyssa, granting a random boon to yourself and a random condition to target foe.

optionalfeature.name: Avatar of Melandru
entries: {@b Description:} Transform into an Avatar of Melandru.

optionalfeature.name: Hounds of Balthazar
entries: {@b Description:} Summon two Hounds of Balthazar to fight at your side.

optionalfeature.name: Reaper of Grenth
entries: {@b Properties:} Summon, Inflicts Chill, Inflicts Poison
{@b Description:} Become a Reaper of Grenth, chilling and poisoning nearby foes.

optionalfeature.name: Blessing of Dwayna

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Prayer to Dwayna

entries: {@b Description:} Beseech Dwayna to restore health and grant regeneration to allies at target location.

optionalfeature.name: Blessing of Kormir

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Prayer to Kormir

entries: {@b Description:} Beseech Kormir to remove one condition from your allies at the target location.

optionalfeature.name: Blessing of Lyssa

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Prayer to Lyssa

entries: {@b Description:} Pray to Lyssa, granting a random boon to allies and a random condition to foes at target location.

optionalfeature.name: Oakheart Swipe
entries: {@b Description:} Strike a nearby foe with a massive swipe.

optionalfeature.name: Cleansing Leaves
entries: {@b Description:} Shake, removing conditions from nearby allies.

optionalfeature.name: Summon Healing Spring
entries: {@b Description:} Slam your fist on the ground creating a healing area that heals allies.

optionalfeature.name: Binding Roots
entries: {@b Description:} Entangle nearby foes with binding roots, preventing them from moving until the roots have been destroyed.

optionalfeature.name: Norn Hunting Skills
entries: Your learned the wayy of the Norn. You learn the following {@variantrule Skill|GW2|skills} and can prepare them as you gain access to features that allow you to prepare them:
{@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills}: {@optfeature Call Owl|GW2} and {@optfeature Call Wurm|GW2}.
{@variantrule Elite Skill|GW2|Elite Skills}: {@optfeature Become the Bear|GW2}, {@optfeature Become the Raven|GW2}, {@optfeature Become the Snow Leopard|GW2} and {@optfeature Become the Wolf|GW2}.

optionalfeature.name: Call Owl
entries: {@b Description:} Call upon an owl to attack and bleed your foe.

optionalfeature.name: Call Wurm
entries: {@b Description:} Summon a wurm to fight for you.

optionalfeature.name: Become the Bear
entries: {@b Description:} Shape-shift into norn bear form.

optionalfeature.name: Become the Raven
entries: {@b Description:} Shape-shift into norn raven form.

optionalfeature.name: Become the Snow Leopard
entries: {@b Description:} Shape-shift into norn snow leopard form.

optionalfeature.name: Become the Wolf
entries: {@b Description:} Shape-shift into norn wolf form.

optionalfeature.name: Fat Wurm Egg

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Call Wurm

entries: {@b Description:} Eat a wurm's egg to gain vigor and regeneration.

optionalfeature.name: Owl Egg

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Call Owl

entries: {@b Description:} Eat an owl's egg to gain swiftness and regeneration.

optionalfeature.name: Swipe
entries: {@b Description:} Lash out with bear claws, damaging foes in front of you.

optionalfeature.name: Brutal Swipe
entries: {@b Description:} Strike foes in front of you with both paws, making them vulnerable.

optionalfeature.name: Heavy Swipe
entries: {@b Description:} Swipe at your foe, knocking them back.

optionalfeature.name: Charge
entries: {@b Description:} Hold down to charge at foe.

optionalfeature.name: Swipe (Raven)
entries: {@b Description:} Lash out with raven wings, damaging your target.

optionalfeature.name: Crippling Swipe
entries: {@b Description:} Lash out with raven wings, damaging and crippling your target.

optionalfeature.name: Shriek
entries: {@b Description:} Let out a wild shriek, dazing nearby foes.

optionalfeature.name: Rending Talons
entries: {@b Description:} Flash repeatedly at foe, inflicting bleeding.

optionalfeature.name: Growl
entries: {@b Description:} Let out a growl, weakening foes.

optionalfeature.name: Pounce
entries: {@b Description:} Leap onto foe, crippling them.

optionalfeature.name: Dash
entries: {@b Description:} Dash at foes. Hold down to increase the length of the dash.

optionalfeature.name: Prowl
entries: {@b Description:} Use Snow Leopard's grace to be unseen by your foes.

optionalfeature.name: Rending Swipe
entries: {@b Description:} Slash at your target, bleeding them twice.

optionalfeature.name: Rending Slash

prerequisite.other: Become the Wolf Transformation. Must follow Rending Swipe.

entries: {@b Description:} Slash at your target, bleeding them four times.

optionalfeature.name: Feral Frenzy

prerequisite.other: Become the Wolf Transformation. Must follow Rending Slash.

entries: {@b Description:} Slash at your target, bleeding them four times.

optionalfeature.name: Howl
entries: {@b Description:} Howl wildly, giving allies fury and regeneration.

optionalfeature.name: Leap
entries: {@b Description:} Leap onto foe, knocking them down.

optionalfeature.name: Sylvari Plant Magic
entries: Your learned the wayy of the Norn. You learn the following {@variantrule Skill|GW2|skills} and can prepare them as you gain access to features that allow you to prepare them:
{@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills}: {@optfeature Grasping Vines|GW2} and {@optfeature Seed Turret|GW2}.
{@variantrule Elite Skill|GW2|Elite Skills}: {@optfeature Summon Druid Spirit|GW2}, {@optfeature Summon Sylvan Hound|GW2} and {@optfeature Take Root|GW2}.

optionalfeature.name: Healing Seed
entries: {@b Description:} Create a healing seed at targeted location which periodically gives nearby allies regeneration.

optionalfeature.name: Grasping Vines
entries: {@b Description:} Target foe becomes entangled by vines, and is unable to move until they have been destroyed.

optionalfeature.name: Seed Turret
entries: {@b Description:} Create a Seed Turret at targeted location which will attack nearby foes.

optionalfeature.name: Summon Druid Spirit
entries: {@b Description:} Summon a Druid Spirit to fight at your side.

optionalfeature.name: Summon Sylvan Hound
entries: {@b Description:} Summon a sylvan hound to fight at your side.

optionalfeature.name: Take Root
entries: {@b Description:} Take root at your current location, becoming immobile, but causing several turrets to grow nearby.

optionalfeature.name: Leafy Bandage

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Healing Seed

entries: {@b Properties:} Heal, Removes Bleeding, Burning, Poison
{@b Description:} Use natural bandages to heal yourself and remove bleeding, burning, and poison.

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Grasping Vines

optionalfeature.name: Throw Vine

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Seed Turret

entries: {@b Description:} Throw a vine and trip your foe.

optionalfeature.name: Reckless Dodge

prerequisite.other: Access to the Strength Trait Line.

entries: Damage foes at the end of a dodge roll.

optionalfeature.name: Brave Stride
entries: Movement skills grant boons and adrenaline when used.

optionalfeature.name: Restorative Strength
entries: Using a heal skill grants might.

optionalfeature.name: Peak Performance
entries: Deal increased strike damage. Physical skills further increase all outgoing strike damage for a period of time.

optionalfeature.name: Building Momentum

prerequisite.other: {@optfeature Brave Stride|GW2} or {@optfeature Restorative Might|GW2} or {@optfeature Peak Performance|GW2}

entries: Burst skills restore endurance on hit.

optionalfeature.name: Body Blow
entries: Stuns, dazes, knockbacks, pulls, pushes, and launches inflict vulnerability and weakness.

optionalfeature.name: Forceful Greatsword
entries: Gain power and a chance to gain might on critical strike. Double these bonuses while wielding a greatsword or underwater spear. Greatsword and underwater spear skills recharge faster.

optionalfeature.name: Great Fortitude
entries: Gain vitality and ferocity based on a percentage of your power.

optionalfeature.name: Pinnacle of Strength

prerequisite.other: {@optfeature Body Blow|GW2} or {@optfeature Forceful Greatsword|GW2} or {@optfeature Great Fortitude|GW2}

entries: Might applied to you grants more power. Your critical-hit chance is increased.

optionalfeature.name: Berserker's Power
entries: Gain increased strike damage when you use a burst skill. This damage increase is based on your adrenaline.

optionalfeature.name: Might Makes Right
entries: Gain health and endurance whenever you apply might to yourself.

optionalfeature.name: Aggressive Onslaught
entries: Gain quickness when you disable an enemy. While you have quickness, your movement speed is increased. This stacks with other movement speed increases.

optionalfeature.name: Furious Burst

prerequisite.other: Access to the Arms Trait Line.

entries: Gain fury when you swap weapons. Fury gives an increased critical chance.

optionalfeature.name: Wounding Precision
entries: Gain expertise based on your precision.

optionalfeature.name: Signet Mastery
entries: Signets grant a stacking ferocity boon on cast. Cast Lesser Signet of Might when striking a foe below the health threshold.

optionalfeature.name: Opportunist
entries: Gain fury and adrenaline when you immobilize or disable a foe.

optionalfeature.name: Deep Strikes

prerequisite.other: {@optfeature Wounding Precision|GW2} or {@optfeature Signet Mastery|GW2} or {@optfeature Opportunist|GW2}

entries: Gain condition damage when you have fury. You have increased chance to critically strike against bleeding foes.

optionalfeature.name: Unsuspecting Foe
entries: Increased critical-hit chance against disabled or defiant foes. Disables include stun, daze, knockback, pull, knockdown, sink, float, launch, taunt, and fear.

optionalfeature.name: Sundering Burst
entries: Burst skills inflict vulnerability if they hit and inflict additional vulnerability if the attack is a critical hit. Can only occur once per interval per target for multihit burst skills.

optionalfeature.name: Blademaster
entries: Gain expertise. Gain condition damage while wielding a sword. Sword skills gain reduced recharge.

optionalfeature.name: Bloodlust

prerequisite.other: {@optfeature Unsuspecting Foe|GW2} or {@optfeature Sundering Burst|GW2} or {@optfeature Blademaster|GW2}

entries: You have a chance to inflict bleeding on critical hits, and bleeds that you apply last longer.

optionalfeature.name: Burst Precision
entries: Burst skills have an increased critical chance. Gain bonus critical-hit chance and ferocity for a duration when you hit with a burst skill. Duration is based on adrenaline spent.

optionalfeature.name: Furious
entries: Critical hits grant bonus adrenaline and gain a stacking condition damage effect.

optionalfeature.name: Dual Wielding
entries: Attack speed is increased when wielding a main-hand weapon in your offhand. Heal when you critically strike a foe while wielding a main-hand weapon in your off hand. This heal is increased when critically striking a bleeding foe.

optionalfeature.name: Thick Skin

prerequisite.other: Access to the Defense Trait Line.

entries: Gain protection when you use a healing skill.

optionalfeature.name: Shield Master
entries: Reflect missiles whenever you are blocking. Gain adrenaline when you block an attack or reflect a missile.

optionalfeature.name: Dogged March
entries: Reduce the duration of movement-impeding conditions and gain regeneration when you are affected by one of these conditions.

optionalfeature.name: Cull the Weak
entries: Deal increased strike damage to weakened foes. Burst skills inflict weakness. Can only occur once per interval per target for multihit burst skills.

optionalfeature.name: Adrenal Health

prerequisite.other: {@optfeature Shield Master|GW2} or {@optfeature Dogged March|GW2} or {@optfeature Cull the Weak|GW2}

entries: Gain health based on adrenaline spent.

optionalfeature.name: Defy Pain
entries: Cast Lesser Endure Pain when you use an elite skill.

optionalfeature.name: Merciless Hammer
entries: Hammer and mace skills deal increased damage when striking a disabled or defiant foe. Gain adrenaline when you disable a foe. Disables include stun, daze, knockback, pull, knockdown, sink, float, launch, taunt, and fear.

optionalfeature.name: Hardened Armor

prerequisite.other: {@optfeature Defy Pain|GW2} or {@optfeature Resilient Roll|GW2} or {@optfeature Merciless Hammer|GW2}

entries: Gain resolution when you block or are struck by a critical hit. Strike damage taken is reduced by a percentage while you have resolution.

optionalfeature.name: Last Stand
entries: Stances grant vigor and barrier when activated, and they have increased duration.

optionalfeature.name: Cleansing Ire
entries: Gain adrenaline when hit. Remove a condition when you hit with a burst skill, then remove an additional condition for every bar of adrenaline spent.

optionalfeature.name: Stalwart Strength
entries: Gain stability when you disable a foe. Deal increased strike damage while you have stability.

prerequisite.other: Access to the Discipline Trait Line.

optionalfeature.name: Crack Shot
entries: Your longbow, rifle, and harpoon gun weapon skill 1 attacks are enhanced.

optionalfeature.name: Warrior's Sprint
entries: Run faster while wielding melee weapons, and deal increased strike damage while you have swiftness. Movement skills break immobilization when used.

optionalfeature.name: Stalwart Focus
entries: Increase your incoming healing effectiveness and healing to other allies.

prerequisite.other: {@optfeature Crack Shot|GW2} or {@optfeature Warrior's Sprint|GW2} or {@optfeature Stalwart Focus|GW2}

optionalfeature.name: Doubled Standards
entries: Banners grant resolution to allies when they are dropped. Pulsing boons applied through banners last longer.

optionalfeature.name: Destruction of the Empowered
entries: Deal increased strike damage per boon on your target.

optionalfeature.name: Brawler's Recovery
entries: Remove conditions when you swap weapons.

optionalfeature.name: Versatile Power

prerequisite.other: {@optfeature Doubled Standards|GW2} or {@optfeature Destruction of the Empowered|GW2} or {@optfeature Brawler's Recovery|GW2}

entries: Gain might on weapon swap. Burst skills gain reduced recharge.

optionalfeature.name: Axe Mastery
entries: Gain ferocity. Gain additional ferocity while wielding an axe. Axe skills gain reduced recharge and grant adrenaline when critically striking.

optionalfeature.name: Heightened Focus
entries: Gain quickness and recharge your burst skills when you strike a foe that is below the health threshold. Gain increased outgoing healing when you strike with a burst skill, based on adrenaline spent.

optionalfeature.name: Burst Mastery
entries: Burst skills deal more damage, grant swiftness, and restore a portion of adrenaline spent.

optionalfeature.name: Marching Orders

prerequisite.other: Access to the Tactics Trait Line.

entries: Periodically gain Soldier's Focus. Hitting with a burst skill expends Soldier's Focus to grant might to nearby allies.

optionalfeature.name: Leg Specialist
entries: Immobilize a target when you cripple them with a skill. Deal increased strike damage to foes affected with movement-impairing conditions.

optionalfeature.name: Soldier's Comfort
entries: Soldier's Focus heals affected allies and grants them protection.

optionalfeature.name: Roaring Reveille
entries: Warhorn skills apply additional boons. Your concentration is increased.

optionalfeature.name: Empowered

prerequisite.other: {@optfeature Leg Specialist|GW2} or {@optfeature Soldier's Comfort|GW2} or {@optfeature Roaring Reveille|GW2}

entries: Deal increased strike damage for every boon on you.

optionalfeature.name: Warrior's Cunning
entries: Deal increased strike damage to foes above the health threshold. Also deal more damage to foes with barrier. Damage bonuses do not stack.

optionalfeature.name: Shrug It Off
entries: Use "Shake It Off!" when you use a healing skill. Removing a damaging condition from an ally heals them.

optionalfeature.name: Empower Allies
entries: While you are in combat, grant might to yourself and nearby allies each interval.

optionalfeature.name: Mending Might

prerequisite.other: {@optfeature Warrior's Cunning|GW2} or {@optfeature Shrug It Off|GW2} or {@optfeature Empower Allies|GW2}

entries: Applying might to an ally heals you.

optionalfeature.name: Martial Cadence
entries: Soldier's Focus grants boons to affected allies and removes conditions from them. Refresh Soldier's Focus when you swap weapons.

optionalfeature.name: Vigorous Shouts
entries: Shout skills heal allies. Gain healing power based on your power.

optionalfeature.name: Phalanx Strength
entries: When you grant yourself might, grant it to nearby allies as well.

optionalfeature.name: Banner of Defense
entries: {@b Properties:} Banner, Grants Barrier, Grants Boons
{@b Description:} Banner. Place a banner that grants barrier and boons on initial placement, then pulses boons to you and nearby allies afterward.

optionalfeature.name: Banner of Discipline
entries: {@b Properties:} Banner, Damage, Inflicts Conditions, Grants Boons
{@b Description:} Banner. Place a banner that damages and applies conditions on initial placement, then pulses additional boons to you and nearby allies afterward.

optionalfeature.name: Banner of Strength
entries: {@b Properties:} Banner, Inflicts Daze, Grants Boons
{@b Description:} Banner. Place a banner that damages and dazes foes on initial placement, then pulses boons to you and nearby allies afterward.

optionalfeature.name: Banner of Tactics
entries: {@b Properties:} Banner, Grants Boons, Breaks Stun
{@b Description:} Banner. Place a banner that grants boons and superspeed and breaks stuns on initial placement, then pulses boons to you and nearby allies afterward.

optionalfeature.name: Bull's Charge
entries: {@b Description:} Physical. Charge and knock down your foe.

optionalfeature.name: Kick
entries: {@b Description:} Physical. Push your foe back with a kick.

optionalfeature.name: Stomp
entries: {@b Properties:} Physical, Grants Stability, Launch, Grants Stability (per strike)
{@b Description:} Physical. Gain stability and launch nearby foes into the air with a powerful stomp. Gain stability for each enemy struck.

optionalfeature.name: Throw Bolas
entries: {@b Description:} Physical. Throw bolas to immobilize your foe.

optionalfeature.name: "Fear Me!"
entries: {@b Properties:} Shout, Inflicts Fear, Distance Scaling
{@b Description:} Shout. Induce fear in your foes. Fear duration increases based on your distance to the enemy.

optionalfeature.name: "For Great Justice!"
entries: {@b Properties:} Shout, Grants Fury, Grants Might
{@b Description:} Shout. Grant fury and might to yourself and allies.

optionalfeature.name: "On My Mark!"
entries: {@b Description:} Shout. Call out target foe to make them vulnerable.

optionalfeature.name: "Shake It Off!"
entries: {@b Properties:} Shout, Cures Conditions, Break Stun
{@b Description:} Shout. Cure conditions on yourself and nearby allies. Also breaks stuns for affected allies.

optionalfeature.name: Dolyak Signet
entries: {@b Properties:} Signet, Damage Reduction, Heal, Grants Stability
{@b Description:} {@b Signet Passive:} Reduces incoming damage.
{@b Effect:} {@b Signet Active:} Heal yourself and gain stability.

optionalfeature.name: Signet of Fury
entries: {@b Properties:} Signet, Grants Precision, Adrenaline Gain, Grants Fury, Grants Ferocity
{@b Effect:} {@b Signet Active:} Gain adrenaline and improve your precision and ferocity.

optionalfeature.name: Signet of Might
entries: {@b Properties:} Signet, Grants Power, Unblockable, Grants Might
{@b Effect:} {@b Signet Active:} Attacks are unblockable and you gain might.

optionalfeature.name: Signet of Stamina
entries: {@b Properties:} Signet, Endurance Regeneration, Cures Conditions, Grants Endurance
{@b Description:} {@b Signet Passive:} Faster endurance regeneration.
{@b Effect:} {@b Signet Active:} Cure all conditions and gain endurance. Gain additional endurance for each condition cured.

optionalfeature.name: Balanced Stance
entries: {@b Properties:} Stance, Grants Stability, Grants Swiftness, Critical Immunity
{@b Description:} Stance. Gain stability and swiftness on an interval. Become immune to critical hits.

optionalfeature.name: Berserker Stance
entries: {@b Properties:} Stance, Adrenaline Gain, Grants Resistance
{@b Description:} Stance. Gain adrenaline for a short time. Gain pulsing resistance.

optionalfeature.name: Endure Pain
entries: {@b Properties:} Stance, Invulnerability, Susceptible to Conditions/Control
{@b Description:} Stance. Take no damage from attacks. You are still susceptible to conditions and control effects.

optionalfeature.name: Frenzy
entries: {@b Properties:} Stance, Grants Quickness, Grants Might
{@b Description:} Stance. Frenzy to gain quickness and might.

optionalfeature.name: Battle Standard
entries: {@b Properties:} Banner, Revives Allies, Finishes Foes, Grants Boons
{@b Description:} Banner. Place a battle standard that revives fallen allies and finishes downed foes. Once placed, the banner periodically grants boons to allies.

optionalfeature.name: Rampage
entries: {@b Properties:} Physical, Transform, Damage Reduction, Condition Duration Reduction
{@b Description:} Physical. Take the form of a massive juggernaut, reducing the damage you take and the duration of incoming movement-impeding conditions.

optionalfeature.name: Signet of Rage
entries: {@b Properties:} Signet, Grants Adrenaline, Grants Fury, Grants Might, Grants Swiftness
{@b Description:} {@b Signet Passive:} Grants adrenaline while in combat.
{@b Effect:} {@b Signet Active:} Gain fury, might, and swiftness.

optionalfeature.name: Bash

prerequisite.other: Rampage Elite Transformation. Must follow Smash.

entries: {@b Description:} Physical. Bash your foe with another blow.

optionalfeature.name: Uppercut

prerequisite.other: Rampage Elite Transformation. Must follow Bash.

entries: {@b Description:} Physical. Finish the chain with a pulverizing uppercut.

optionalfeature.name: Kick
entries: {@b Description:} Physical. Push back your foe with a kick.

optionalfeature.name: Throw Boulder
entries: {@b Description:} Physical. Throw a large boulder at your foe.

optionalfeature.name: Seismic Leap
entries: {@b Description:} Physical. Leap into the air and knock down nearby foes where you land.

optionalfeature.name: Mending
entries: {@b Description:} Physical. Remove conditions and heal yourself.

optionalfeature.name: "To the Limit!"
entries: {@b Properties:} Shout, Heal, Adrenaline Gain, Grants Endurance
{@b Description:} Shout. Heal yourself and regain all adrenaline. Nearby allies gain endurance.

optionalfeature.name: Healing Signet
entries: {@b Effect:} {@b Signet Active:} Heal yourself, and grant yourself resistance.

optionalfeature.name: Defiant Stance
entries: {@b Description:} Stance. Heal yourself. Absorb all incoming strikes for a period of time.

optionalfeature.name: Forceful Shot
entries: {@b Description:} Burst. Fire a forceful shot. Damage increases with adrenaline level.

optionalfeature.name: Mariner's Shot
entries: {@b Description:} Shoot your foe from long range. The farther the shot goes, the more damage it does.

optionalfeature.name: Puncture Shot
entries: {@b Description:} Make your foe vulnerable with a shot to their vitals.

optionalfeature.name: Split Shot
entries: {@b Description:} Your shot splits into a spread of harpoons that each bleed your target.

optionalfeature.name: Knot Shot
entries: {@b Description:} Evade backward and fire a shot that immobilizes your foe.

optionalfeature.name: Repeating Shot
entries: {@b Description:} Fire multiple shots that push back your foe.

optionalfeature.name: Whirling Strike
entries: {@b Description:} Burst. Strike all foes around you. Effect increases with adrenaline level.

optionalfeature.name: Impale
entries: {@b Description:} Impale your foe and cripple them.

optionalfeature.name: Mariner's Frenzy
entries: {@b Description:} Attack foes in front of you with a series of strikes.

optionalfeature.name: Barbed Pull
entries: {@b Description:} Pull your foe to you.

optionalfeature.name: Parry
entries: {@b Properties:} Block, Counterattack, Grants Adrenaline (on miss)
{@b Description:} Block your foe. Counterattack with a powerful strike. Gain adrenaline if you are not attacked.

optionalfeature.name: Tsunami Slash
entries: {@b Description:} Spin forward and strike foes along the way.

optionalfeature.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@b Description:} Bash your foe with your shield and stun them.

optionalfeature.name: Charge
entries: {@b Description:} Grant boons and remove movement-impairing conditions from allies.

optionalfeature.name: Call of Valor
entries: {@b Properties:} Removes Conditions, Grants Vigor, Grants Barrier
{@b Description:} Removes conditions from allies and grants them vigor. Affected targets also gain barrier.

optionalfeature.name: Flurry
entries: {@b Description:} Burst. Immobilize your foes with a flurry of bleeding strikes. Effect increases with adrenaline level.

optionalfeature.name: Sever Artery
entries: {@b Description:} Chain. Bleed your foe with a slash.

optionalfeature.name: Gash

prerequisite.other: Requires Sword. Must follow Sever Artery.

entries: {@b Description:} Chain. Bleed your foe with a gash.

optionalfeature.name: Hamstring
entries: {@b Description:} Cripple your foe with a precise slash.

optionalfeature.name: Savage Leap
entries: {@b Description:} Lunge at your foe and strike them with your sword.

optionalfeature.name: Final Thrust
entries: {@b Properties:} Increased Damage, Inflicts Bleeding (Low Health)
{@b Description:} Strike your foe with a final powerful thrust that does extra damage and inflicts bleeding against foes below the health threshold.

optionalfeature.name: Impale
entries: {@b Description:} Throw your sword at your foe to impale them.

optionalfeature.name: Rip
entries: {@b Description:} Rip your sword from your foe for extra damage.

optionalfeature.name: Riposte
entries: {@b Properties:} Block, Inflicts Bleeding, Grants Adrenaline (on block/miss)
{@b Description:} Block the next attack. Riposte and bleed your foe if you block a melee attack. Gain adrenaline if you are not attacked.

optionalfeature.name: Adrenaline Rush
entries: {@b Description:} Stop blocking and swing out with an attack.

optionalfeature.name: Eviscerate
entries: {@b Description:} Burst. Leap at your foe with a devastating attack. Effect increases with adrenaline level.

optionalfeature.name: Double Chop
entries: {@b Description:} Chain. Chop your foe twice.

optionalfeature.name: Triple Chop

prerequisite.other: Requires Axe. Must follow Double Chop.

entries: {@b Description:} Deliver three final chops to your foe.

optionalfeature.name: Cyclone Axe
entries: {@b Properties:} Spin, Grants Fury, Inflicts Vulnerability
{@b Description:} Spin around and attack all nearby foes, applying vulnerability each hit. Gain fury for each foe hit.

optionalfeature.name: Throw Axe
entries: {@b Description:} Throw an axe that cripples foes, dealing bonus damage at lower health thresholds.

optionalfeature.name: Dual Strike
entries: {@b Description:} Strike your foe with both weapons. Gain quickness for each strike that hits.

optionalfeature.name: Whirling Axe
entries: {@b Description:} Spin and attack nearby foes. You can move while spinning.

optionalfeature.name: Skull Crack
entries: {@b Description:} Burst. Stun your foe with a skull crack. Effect increases with adrenaline level.

prerequisite.other: Requires Mace. Must follow Mace Smash.

optionalfeature.name: Pulverize

prerequisite.other: Requires Mace. Must follow Mace Bash.

entries: {@b Description:} Thrash your foe, leaving them weakened.

optionalfeature.name: Counterblow
entries: {@b Description:} Block the next attack. Counter with an attack if you are in melee range.

optionalfeature.name: Tactical Blow
entries: {@b Description:} Stop blocking and swing out with an attack.

optionalfeature.name: Pommel Bash
entries: {@b Properties:} Daze, Grants Barrier (on skill strike)
{@b Description:} Daze your foe with a brutal pommel bash. If you strike a foe that is using a skill, gain barrier.

optionalfeature.name: Crushing Blow
entries: {@b Properties:} Inflicts Vulnerability, Grants Might, Damage

{@b Description:} Crush your opponent's armor, leaving them vulnerable and gaining might. Vulnerability and might stacks doubled if you hit a disabled foe. Disables include stun, daze, knockback, pull, knockdown, sink, float, launch, taunt, and fear. Recharges Crushing Blow if you strike an enemy.

optionalfeature.name: Tremor
entries: {@b Description:} Smash the ground with your mace, damaging your target and sending out a shock wave that damages and knocks down foes.

optionalfeature.name: Combustive Shot
entries: {@b Description:} Burst. Ignite target area, burning nearby foes. Effect increases with adrenaline level.

optionalfeature.name: Dual Shot
entries: {@b Description:} Shoot a pair of arrows at your foe.

optionalfeature.name: Fan of Fire
entries: {@b Description:} Fire a spread of three flaming arrows, burning foes.

optionalfeature.name: Arcing Arrow
entries: {@b Description:} Shoot a slow, arcing arrow that explodes on impact.

optionalfeature.name: Smoldering Arrow
entries: {@b Description:} Shoot an arrow that explodes on impact, blinding foes.

optionalfeature.name: Pin Down
entries: {@b Description:} Fire an arrow that bleeds and immobilizes your target.

optionalfeature.name: Kill Shot
entries: {@b Description:} Burst. Fire a powerful shot. Damage increases with adrenaline level. Deal increased damage to enemies that are affected by crowd control or below the health threshold.

optionalfeature.name: Fierce Shot
entries: {@b Description:} Fire a shot at your target. Gain might if you strike a vulnerable target.

optionalfeature.name: Volley
entries: {@b Description:} Fire a volley of shots at your foe.

optionalfeature.name: Explosive Shell
entries: {@b Description:} Shoot an explosive round that explodes when it hits, striking nearby enemies and enemies in a cone behind the initial target.

optionalfeature.name: Brutal Shot
entries: {@b Description:} Evade backward while firing an immobilizing shot.

optionalfeature.name: Rifle Butt
entries: {@b Properties:} Knockback, Recharge Boost (Rifle Burst), Ammunition Recovery

{@b Description:} Knock back your foe with your rifle butt. Recover ammunition for each of your other rifle skills and fully recharge your rifle burst skills. Successfully striking a foe reduces the recharge time of this skill.

optionalfeature.name: Earthshaker
entries: {@b Description:} Burst. Jump to the targeted location and slam your hammer down, damaging and stunning foes.

optionalfeature.name: Hammer Bash

prerequisite.other: Requires Hammer. Must follow Hammer Swing.

entries: {@b Description:} Chain. Bash your foe again.

optionalfeature.name: Hammer Smash

prerequisite.other: Requires Hammer. Must follow Hammer Bash.

entries: {@b Description:} Smash the ground and damage nearby foes.

optionalfeature.name: Fierce Blow
entries: {@b Description:} Weaken your foe with a fierce blow, dealing increased damage when striking a controlled or defiant foe. Controls include stun, daze, knockback, pull, knockdown, sink, float, launch, taunt, and fear.

optionalfeature.name: Hammer Shock
entries: {@b Description:} Smash the ground and send out a crippling wave.

optionalfeature.name: Staggering Blow
entries: {@b Description:} Push back nearby foes with a staggering blow.

optionalfeature.name: Backbreaker
entries: {@b Properties:} Knockdown, Recharge Boost (Fierce Blow), Control Check

{@b Description:} Knock down your foe. Weakened foes stay knocked down longer. Recharges Fierce Blow if you control a foe with this ability. Recharges Fierce Blow if striking a target with a defiance bar.

optionalfeature.name: Arcing Slice
entries: {@b Description:} Burst. Deliver a circular attack to foes around you, and gain fury. Deal more damage to foes with low health.

prerequisite.other: Requires Greatsword. Must follow Greatsword Swing.

optionalfeature.name: Brutal Strike

prerequisite.other: Requires Greatsword. Must follow Greatsword Slice.

entries: {@b Description:} Hit your foe with a final brutal strike.

optionalfeature.name: Hundred Blades
entries: {@b Description:} Repeatedly strike multiple foes. The last strike does extra damage.

optionalfeature.name: Whirlwind Attack
entries: {@b Description:} Whirl in a target's direction, slashing foes along your path.

optionalfeature.name: Bladetrail
entries: {@b Description:} Throw your greatsword at your foe so that it returns to you, crippling foes along the way.

optionalfeature.name: Rush
entries: {@b Description:} Charge and strike your foe.

optionalfeature.name: Fireball
entries: {@b Description:} Cast a fireball that explodes on impact and hits multiple foes.

optionalfeature.name: Lava Font
entries: {@b Description:} Make lava erupt from the target area.

optionalfeature.name: Flame Burst
entries: {@b Description:} Burn foes at the target location.

optionalfeature.name: Burning Retreat
entries: {@b Properties:} Roll, Inflicts Burn, Fire Field
{@b Description:} Quickly roll backward, leaving behind a line of fire that burns.

optionalfeature.name: Meteor Shower
entries: {@b Description:} Call down a meteor shower onto the target area. Damage is reduced per target each time they are struck by this ability.

optionalfeature.name: Water Blast
entries: {@b Description:} Spray a jet of water at your foe that splashes to heal nearby allies.

optionalfeature.name: Ice Spike
entries: {@b Description:} Drop a giant ice spike on foes to make them vulnerable.

optionalfeature.name: Geyser
entries: {@b Description:} Create a geyser to heal nearby allies.

optionalfeature.name: Frozen Ground
entries: {@b Properties:} Inflicts Chill, Grants Frost Aura, Ice Field
{@b Description:} Coat the target area in ice, chilling foes that enter it. Grant frost aura to allies in the area.

optionalfeature.name: Healing Rain
entries: {@b Properties:} Heal, Grants Regeneration, Removes Conditions, Water Field
{@b Description:} Call down a healing rain on the target area, granting regeneration to allies and curing conditions once every three seconds. Allies are healed for each condition removed.

optionalfeature.name: Chain Lightning
entries: {@b Description:} Hit multiple foes with arcs of chain lightning.

optionalfeature.name: Lightning Surge
entries: {@b Description:} Charge a lightning surge that damages and blinds foes near your target when it discharges.

optionalfeature.name: Gust
entries: {@b Description:} Push foes backward with a burst of air.

optionalfeature.name: Windborne Speed
entries: {@b Properties:} Grants Swiftness, Removes Cripple, Immobilize, Chill
{@b Description:} You and nearby allies gain swiftness, while curing crippled, immobilized, and chilled.

optionalfeature.name: Static Field
entries: {@b Description:} Create an electrical field that stuns foes crossing it.

optionalfeature.name: Stoning
entries: {@b Description:} Hurl a rock and weaken your foe.

optionalfeature.name: Eruption
entries: {@b Description:} Shake the ground until it erupts and damages foes.

optionalfeature.name: Magnetic Aura
entries: {@b Description:} Reflect projectiles with magnetic energy.

optionalfeature.name: Transmute Earth
entries: {@b Description:} Cause the surrounding magnetic aura to violently explode.

optionalfeature.name: Unsteady Ground
entries: {@b Description:} Create unsteady ground that foes cannot cross.

optionalfeature.name: Shock Wave
entries: {@b Description:} Create a shock wave that bleeds and immobilizes your target.

optionalfeature.name: Flamestrike
entries: {@b Description:} Strike your foe with flame.

optionalfeature.name: Dragon's Tooth
entries: {@b Description:} Drop an explosive dragon's tooth on your foe.

optionalfeature.name: Phoenix
entries: {@b Properties:} Explodes, Cures Condition, Grants Vigor, Inflicts Burning

{@b Description:} Release a fiery phoenix that attacks foes in a line before exploding and returning to you, curing a condition and granting you vigor. Inflict additional burning against foes that are already burning.

optionalfeature.name: Ice Shards
entries: {@b Description:} Fire three ice shards at your foe.

optionalfeature.name: Shatterstone
entries: {@b Description:} Cast a shatterstone that will explode at the target area.

optionalfeature.name: Water Trident
entries: {@b Description:} Cast a water trident that damages foes. Deal more damage to chilled foes and heal for each target struck. Heal for a lesser amount for each target struck beyond the first.

optionalfeature.name: Arc Lightning
entries: {@b Description:} Cast an arc of electricity at your foe.

optionalfeature.name: Lightning Strike
entries: {@b Description:} Strike your foes with lightning.

optionalfeature.name: Blinding Flash
entries: {@b Description:} Blind your foe with a flash of light. Vulnerable foes are also weakened.

optionalfeature.name: Stone Shards
entries: {@b Description:} Fling stone daggers at your foe to bleed them.

optionalfeature.name: Rock Barrier
entries: {@b Description:} Envelope yourself in a stony barrier that improves toughness.

optionalfeature.name: Hurl
entries: {@b Description:} Hurl the rocks from your barrier at your foe.

optionalfeature.name: Dust Devil
entries: {@b Properties:} Inflicts Cripple, Inflicts Bleeding, Inflicts Blind
{@b Description:} Create a dust storm that inflicts cripple to bleeding foes. The first strike of the storm blinds foes.

optionalfeature.name: Dragon's Claw
entries: {@b Description:} Fling fire in a claw-shaped spread at your foe.

optionalfeature.name: Drake's Breath
entries: {@b Description:} Spray a cone of fire at foes while on the move.

optionalfeature.name: Burning Speed
entries: {@b Description:} Slide forward and blast the area, leaving behind a line of fire that burns foes.

optionalfeature.name: Ring of Fire
entries: {@b Description:} Damage nearby foes with a ring of fire, burning foes that pass through it.

optionalfeature.name: Fire Grab
entries: {@b Description:} Damage foes in a cone in front of you. Deal more damage to burning foes.

optionalfeature.name: Vapor Blade
entries: {@b Description:} Cast a vapor blade that inflicts vulnerability and returns to you.

optionalfeature.name: Cone of Cold
entries: {@b Description:} Spray an icy blast in a cone that damages foes and heals allies.

optionalfeature.name: Frozen Burst
entries: {@b Description:} Detonate a burst of ice that chills nearby foes.

optionalfeature.name: Frost Aura
entries: {@b Properties:} Frost Aura, Grants Protection, Inflicts Chill
{@b Description:} Protect yourself with frost armor that reduces incoming damage by 10%. While active, it chills foes that hit you. Each attacker can be affected by this only once per second.

optionalfeature.name: Transmute Frost
entries: {@b Description:} Cause your frost aura to violently explode, healing allies and damaging foes.

optionalfeature.name: Cleansing Wave
entries: {@b Description:} Heal yourself and nearby allies, curing conditions.

optionalfeature.name: Lightning Whip
entries: {@b Description:} Lash your foe with lightning.

optionalfeature.name: Convergence
entries: {@b Description:} Charge the air to shock foes around you after a short delay. Inflict weakness on enemies and gain fury for each foe struck. Each attacker can be affected by this only once every 2 seconds.

optionalfeature.name: Shocking Aura
entries: {@b Description:} Envelop yourself with electrical energy that stuns nearby foes if they attack you. Each attacker can be affected by this only once every 2 seconds.

optionalfeature.name: Transmute Lightning
entries: {@b Description:} Cause your shocking aura to violently explode, stunning enemies who are struck by it.

optionalfeature.name: Ride the Lightning
entries: {@b Description:} Ride the lightning to your foe, then strike all nearby foes with an electrical burst. If a foe is hit by the burst, the skill's recharge is halved.
